intro: Gyrostachys pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf sunflower, is a small annual herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with narrow, linear leaves and yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
